reviews.title: nice hotel
reviews.text: Stayed at Eldan for a week.(12?16/06-12/24/06). Nice hotel.Clean.Good breakfast(included in the price of the room).Paid abot $98.00 per night for two.Only problem-no coffe maker in the room.(like most of the Israeli hotels).Good location.Car rental in the same building.

reviews.title: Great Budget Hotel
reviews.text: Stayed at the Eldan in September. Excellent budget hotel. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Room was comfortable and very, very clean. No Queen or King beds though. Free breakfast was plentiful and fresh. If you are on a budget, this is truly a great place to stay - it is in a terrific location, within walking distance to the old city and Ben Yehuda.

reviews.title: A positive experience
reviews.text: I first heard about the Eldan from Trip Advisor and although I was hesitant I went ahead and booked it. Some family members were staying across the street and we needed to be nearby. The Eldan is in an excellent location, right across the street from the King David Hotel. The price is excellent. We stayed for five nights, the fourth night was free! The lobby is very small but pleasant. There are free newspapers and a decent breakfast is included daily. The staff is friendly and tries to accommodate. The biggest drawback for me was the lack of closet space. There is hardly any hanging space, my husband had to hang his clothes on the chairs. I would recommend it for a couple, too small for a family.

reviews.title: The best value for your money
reviews.text: I stayed at the Eldan for an entire week and found it to be quite pleasant. The location is superb and the room was clean and quite. Granted the hotel itself doesn’t have 5 star accommodations but then again if that is what you want – you should go across the street to the King David and pay the extra $200 per night.

reviews.title: very nice for the price
reviews.text: I paid $120 per night (plus $30 for 7 days of Wi-Fi internet access). For that you get a continental breakfast, a great location, and a safe place to rest at night. If you are familiar with the major Hotel chains then I would say that this compares favorably with a Holiday Inn. All things considered, I doubt you will find a better value in Jerusalem.

Had a reservation for 3 persons. Arrived late to find the room set with 3 beds, but only 2 sets of towels and 2 cups. When we went downstairs the front desk man was outside smoking, and finally produced one towel saying everything else was dirty laundry. The bathroom mirror was cracked in 2 places, the overhead shower head did not work, bathtub grout needs regrouting, towels were poor quality.Water pressure and temperature difficult to regulate. As we paid $240 a night, this was not at all the service level that I expected. Service all in all was poor. There are tables set outside and when we sat down, hoping to order drinks, we eventually needed to go to the front desk to place our order. The beer arrived in bottles, with no glasses.Speaking with the front desk, the supervisor offerred 10% off first night stay due to the bad set up and condition of the room...
reviews.title: needs to get their act together

reviews.text: On the positive side: The breakfast buffet is excellent. Great selection of cheese, pastries, fish, warm and cold options, a definate great start to the day. Wifi in the rooms is fast and connection is good. Location of the hotel is a short walk from the Jaffa gate and the neighborhood seems good to upscale. Girls at the front desk are pleasant and try to be helpful
reviews.title: Don't go to this hotel !!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: We did have trouble finding places to have dinner as the hotel was not serving same.
reviews.title: eldan hotel, jerusalem

reviews.text: For the price, I suggest you look around.
reviews.title: Excellent Location and very safe

reviews.text: I paid my hotel stay with hotel.com, I checked my bill before I left, it had a zero balance. Two days later I found the Eldan Hotel had deduced my two night stay AGAIN on my creditcard. After numerous emails to the hotel and Hotel.com I have not received my refund now three months later. Please note they keep saying the refund will happen as soon as final approval is given..........RUBBISH. This hotel is dishonested...........DO NOT STAY THERE.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great staff and breakfast, and quite close from old town

reviews.text: This was my 2nd July at the Eldan, each year for 15 consecutive nights. This year, the hotel is starting to show wear and tear. I would consider it to be Jerusalem's best 2*/3* hotel. Still great convenience, great breakfast w/room, quiet. I would stay there again.
reviews.title: it's not 2006
Met all our needs
reviews.text: We spent three nights at the Eldan Hotel this past June. The hotel is small but organized and attractrive. The room was very comfortable and clean. The buffet breakfast was good and plentiful. We were able to park our rental car in the basement for no extra fee. The hotel is located on King David street, just blocks of the Old City, a beautiful park, and a busy metropolitan shopping area. Overall, we were very pleased. We paid $149 per night for 3 people including the breakfast. The King David Hotel is across the street and we ate a late lunch there one day out on the patio which was lovely with the Old City in the background. They also have a small drug store there with calling cards, and pay phones (the pay phones at the Eldan are very expensive). The reception staff at the Eldan is not overly gracious and friendly but we didn't let it bother us as they weren't really rude either. Overall, we'd likely choose to stay there again. If you're planning to rent a car, the hotel/rental deals offered by the hotel on their website looked pretty good.
After reading many reviews of the Eldan on this website, my wife, our 10 month old son and I decided to stay there. In short, we really enjoyed our stay and will definitely be going back.
reviews.title: Excellent Value

reviews.text: The good:
reviews.title: A very mixed bag in a superb location

reviews.text: 1. Location, Location, Location - a 10 / 15 minute walk to the old city, a similar distance to Ben Yehuda
reviews.title: There was feces all over the floor!
Great location and Hotel
reviews.text: We stayed in the Eldan in February 2006 for 4 nights. The location is perfect, a few minute walk to either the old city or downtown. The rooms were clean, the staff nice, and the breakfests good. There is nothing I can say bad about the place. The rooms were cleaned early each day. There was daily linen service, which is not the norm in Israel. Its not the King David, but you are not paying King David rates. For the money, you can't get a better value. I would stay there again, which in my mind, is the highest recommendation you can give a hotel.

reviews.title: Comfortable, near Jaffa Gate
reviews.text: The Eldan is located near the Jaffa Gate of

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We flew from Canada and checked in at the Eldan October 14 for 7 days and were pleasantly surprised by the warm welcome we received. We found a good rate on line and had booked way in advance which helped get us the queen bed and good rate. This was not a modern furnished room but it was a good size, very clean, and the mattress was very comfortable. It had a small fridge where we were able to keep bottled water and some fruit. The airconditioning is somewhat noisy. The bathroom shower was not the standard western model but quite serviceable. You would need to bring a hair dryer as the one they have is old style and awkward to use. But the bathroom is cleaned daily very well. The breakfast was fantastic and lots to choose from for every type of diet. Apparently they serve lunch on Saturday but no one told us this when we checked in. There is a computer in the lobby for guests for a small fee.
reviews.title: small friendly hotel in good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is excellent--across from the King David hotel and next door to the Jerusalem YMCA where we had a couple of excellent dinners on their patio. The Mamila shopping plaza is within walking distance. The Eldan car rental company is next door and that is convenient.
reviews.title: A nice averege hotel

reviews.text: We found the front desk staff wonderfully helpful. Especially the two young women, Adi and Lynette. They are warm and friendly and will go out of their way to help you with reservations or information and they speak English very well. I would not hesitate to stay there again next time we go to Jerusalem and recommend it if you are looking for an intimate friendly hotel that is well kept and reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Jerusalem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: E.S.
reviews.title: a lovely small motel near the city

reviews.text: We stayed in Eldan during a week end. It's a nice hotel specially for observent Jews who don't want to spent a lot of money but still stay in proximity to holly places.
reviews.title: Good location, mediocre rooms and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for two days in this small and nice hotel. Great location, we were out all day, so we only slept there and had breakfast. Nice staff with alot of info about the city. Great value for money overall.
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.text: I spent 2 weeks in Jerusalem in January 2013 and stayed at the Eldan Hotel. The location of this small, quiet hotel is the BEST in Jerusalem, across from the King David and next to the YMCA. It's a 5 minute walk to the Mamila Mall and about 8 minutes to the old city as well as easy walking distance (10 to 15 minutes) to downtown Jerusalem.
reviews.title: 2 Weeks at Eldan
Disappointed
reviews.text: I found the staff to be very friendly, especially in the dining room in the morning (Ahmed and Basem are two very nice fellows). The breakfasts at the Eldan are varied and plentiful...my favorite was the "shakshuka" (egg poached in spicy tomato sauce), along with fresh veggies, olives, and cheeses. There is always a great selection of fresh crossiants and various breads.

The Eldan has been around for a while so it is not smashingly new decor, but the hotel is clean and quiet, full bathrooms (with tubs and showers...unlike some which just have showers) and safes in every room. This was all were perfect for my business/pleasure stay and about HALF the price of the other hotels on this block.
reviews.title: Average Stay

reviews.text: Do keep in mind that you are in the Middle East and even the rooms at the greatest hotels here are not the same as great hotel rooms in US resorts based on my experience.
reviews.title: Simple truth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Best location in Jerusalem, 1 minute walk from Mamila and Old City. Excellent atention in front desk. Parking is uppon availavility. Very good breakfast. The room was clean. Ask for a high floor if possible.
reviews.title: Excelent location, excelent service

reviews.text: I loved the location =short walk to Old City, Ben Yahooda the lively pedestrian mall area beautiful resturants. Also the price seemed reasonable. My room seemed very clean and comfortable and they give a big breakfast.
reviews.title: I loved the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They booked me on Bein Tour which was a nightmare. They picked me up 1 1/2 hours late and made a 10 minute drop off last 1 hour plus they charged 100$ for a trip that the entrance to dead sea was 2$ Just take a taxi!
reviews.title: functional in very good location

reviews.text: we were two couples on one night vacation, we looked for low cost hotel in good location
reviews.title: Overpriced with tiny ugly rooms and a hostile and incompetent staff.

reviews.text: The hotel was very nice in very good location, we walked to all the sites by feet and there was no need for car.
reviews.title: Good family hotel
great small, inexpensive hotel!
reviews.text: Loved it! Great, quiet location across from the beautiful King David (which I couldn't afford) but within walking distance (for healthy person) of central Jerusalem, Ben Yehuda Street, etc. I found hotel boutique-ish in the best possible sense, i.e. it did not feel like Grand Central Station or an airport, but had a small, friendly, homey feel. Building itself is very nice. Lobby and ground-floor dining room have very high ceilings, giving spacious, light-filled feel. My room was excellent (for about $99 a night!) and had a view, lots of light, big bed. Even sheets--and I am a thread count queen--were soft, not five star-hotel-soft, but soft.

reviews.title: The Eldan Made My Mom Very, Very Happy
reviews.text: I stayed with my mother, who is disabled, for eight nights at the Eldan. My mother requires a hospital bed, wheelchair, and a disabled-friendly bathroom.

reviews.title: Good Value & Location
reviews.text: From the very first time I called the Eldan, the staff couldn't have been kinder or more eager to help. They were completely willing to work with Yad Sarah, the non-profit org. that provides hospital beds, wheelchairs, etc., to the disabled.

reviews.title: Fine small hotel, great location
reviews.text: The night we arrived, we found that the Eldan had not only given us their ground-floor disabled-friendly room, but that the hospital bed had been installed and was functional, and that a perfectly good wheelchair was waiting for us in the room.

reviews.title: Very nice, close to Old City
reviews.text: The staff speak excellent English and were always very kind and patient with my mom, which was important as she is shy and somewhat embarrassed of her disabilities.
